alert.note: Alert for Attala; Choctaw; Leake; Oktibbeha; Winston (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 17 at 2:20PM CST until February 17 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Leake County in central Mississippi... Southern Choctaw County in central Mississippi... Southwestern Oktibbeha County in northeastern Mississippi... Eastern Attala County in central Mississippi... Winston County in east central Mississippi... * Until 300 PM CST. * At 220 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles north of Zama, or 14 miles east of Kosciusko, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Louisville and Mcmillan around 235 PM CST. Millcreek around 240 PM CST. Betheden around 245 PM CST. Craig Springs around 250 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Noxapater, Mccool, Ethel, French Camp, Sturgis and Weir. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for central Mississippi. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 800 PM CST for northeastern and east central Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
